40229482.review:
Pac-Man 256 is a combination of classic arcade action and endless runner elements. The original characters from the classic game are included here, along with some more original and gimicky ghosts that will try to block your path or fall asleep until you get close to them, then try to attack quickly.

Along with the typical power pellets there are numerous upgradable power-ups at your disposal, of which 3 can be equipped at a time to randomly appear at points in the maze. The game features many varied missions that you can complete to gain coins that can be used to upgrade your power-ups and increase their duration and the amount of points you gain from using them well.

As well as the standard single player mode, the game also includes a multi player mode where up to 4 players can work together to survive as long as possible, or compete with each other for the highest score.

If you're a fan of classic arcade games, endless runner games or just want something to play with friends and mess around, I highly recommend this.

39644313.review:
致敬PACMAN和我们过去的时光。（游戏部分引用百科和Wiki，侵权删）
首先说明一下这个游戏曾经进过HB的1刀周包，可以去网上找一下说不定有卖。
1979年某天，岩谷彻拿起了面前的一块薄饼正大口咬下，突然他低头注视缺了一角的Pizza，这个却角的薄饼成为了Pac-Man的原型，也是这个不经意的想法，成就了一代人的记忆。
PACMAN最早由南梦宫公司于1980年在街机上推出，后由雅达利公司于1982年3月中旬发售Atari 2600版。雅达利甚至为了这个游戏，举办了一个吃豆人节，可见当初这个游戏也是相当有人气。很可惜的是，雅达利版本卖的不好，最终不了了之。
很可惜的是我个人并没有玩过雅达利版本的PACMAN，最早接触的应该是小霸王版本吧。当初印象最深刻的是会喜欢莫名其妙地去怼鬼，可惜失败。目前可以在3ds和wiiu上依旧能够购买到当初的VC版本（原版），gb版本好像已经下架，但是日亚能够买到下载码。国内在上个世纪末到现在甚至可以看到很多PACMAN的改版，增加鬼的个数啊，封闭掉迷宫啊什么的，甚至还有无敌版。增加或者降低游戏难度的版本比比皆是。
（未完待续）

39407814.review:
Another neat take on the classic but by the time you're gunning for that 100% upgrades achievement there's little content left. Just grinding away at the little tasks hoping for a payout higher than 256 to afford those 2048 a pop level 8 upgrades. Any improvement on your single player game seems to come down more to luck than skill because you're having to choose paths where you can't see what's up ahead, usually with a couple of reds on your tail. Multiplayer seems totally different in this regard with its infinite revives. The single player mode could do with a similar chance of survival, maybe like a random teleport/respawn ability recharged with the 256 dot streaks.

Definitely recommended for the novelty, low to moderate level gameplay and multiplayer. But with such a large element of the difficulty being randomness with a desolately inevitable outcome, the game discourages you from getting good because getting lucky will always matter more.

Good outing, Bandai Namco. Don't stop experimenting.

38826948.review:
Pac-Man 256 fait partie des jeux qui me font regretter qu'il n'y ait pas de verdict "mitigé" sur Steam.

D'un côté, Pac-Man 256 est une excellente adaptation des mécaniques de Pac-Man à la structure d'un [i]endless runner:[/i] au lieu de toujours évoluer dans le même labyrinthe, Pac-Man doit ici fuir le bug qui survient dans la borne d'arcade originale au 256ème écran, le labyrinthe de Pac-Man 256 partant ainsi à l'infini en haut à droite de l'écran alors que le bug y vient d'en bas à gauche, déferlant à la façon d'un tsunami et nous forçant à aller de l'avant.

Afin d'accorder le gameplay original à la génération aléatoire du labyrinthe, les schémas de déplacement des fantômes ont été altérés plutôt intelligemment: Blinky (rouge) chasse toujours Pac-Man comme dans la borne d'origine, mais les autres ont maintenant des comportements plus mécaniques et prévisibles - Inky (cyan) longe systématiquement le même mur, Clyde (orange) va vers le bas dès qu'il en a la possibilité, Pinky (rose) reste sur place mais fonce en ligne droite vers Pac-Man dès qu'elle le repère, et de nouveaux fantômes (gris, verts, etc.) ont des comportements tout autant clairs et intuitifs.

Dans le même ordre d'idées, les fruits ne sont plus de simples bonus, ce sont désormais des multiplicateurs de points pour un temps limité: les cerises accordent du x2, les pommes du x3, les fraises du x4, les oranges du x5 et les melons du x6, ce qui bien sûr les rend tous cruciaux pour le [i]scoring[/i].

Il y a aussi une nouvelle mécanique de combo de pastilles, le labyrinthe n'étant plus entièrement rempli de pastilles et comportant des "trous": en mangeant plus de 16 pastilles d'affilée, on gagne l'équivalent de notre combo en score pour toute puissance de 2, à savoir 16, 32, 64, 128 et 256. Quand on mange 256 pastilles d'affilée, le combo est brisé, mais tous les fantômes présents dans le labyrinthe sont détruits simultanément, ce qui rapporte évidemment beaucoup de points, surtout si on a mangé un fruit juste avant que ça n'arrive.

Pour encore pimenter les choses, les super pac-gommes ne sont plus les seuls [i]powerups,[/i] il y a désormais 21 nouveaux [i]powerups[/i] que Pac-Man peut utiliser à son avantage, le joueur choisissant lui-même avant de commencer sa partie les trois nouveaux [i]powerups[/i] qu'il veut voir apparaître. Afin que les super pac-gommes conservent un avantage, elles restent le seul [i]powerup[/i] dont le score est progressif plus on détruit de fantômes (10 points pour le premier, puis 20 points, puis 30, puis 40, etc.). Pendant l'activation d'un [i]powerup,[/i] les autres types de [i]powerups[/i] sont changés en petits cubes qui prolongeront l'effet de celui en cours.

Toutes ces mécaniques sont parfaitement huilées et présentent un équilibre subtil de risques et récompenses très satisfaisant qui renouvelle Pac-Man assez brillamment, le jeu procurant d'excellentes sensations au début. Mais hélas, d'un autre côté, le jeu est pourri stupidement par sa structure originelle de jeu pour téléphones et tablettes...

En pratique, le score est malheureusement complètement secondaire dans Pac-Man 256, toute l'expérience du jeu étant axée sur la collecte interminable d'argent et de pastilles: en collectant des dizaines de milliers de pastilles, on débloquera les [i]powerups[/i] un par un et de façon linéaire, et l'argent permet quant à lui d'améliorer les [i]powerups[/i] afin qu'ils durent plus longtemps et rapportent plus de points quand un fantôme est détruit (plus de 85000 crédits à dépenser pour que tout soit au maximum). Collecter de l'argent ne demande aucun talent et n'a aucun intérêt, il faut essentiellement remplir des "missions" du genre "collecter deux melons" ou "collecter tel type de [i]powerup[/i] cinq fois". Il y a de l'argent dans le labyrinthe, mais les missions en rapportent incomparablement plus, le plus efficace étant de suicider Pac-Man dès qu'une mission est remplie afin d'avoir immédiatement accès à une autre mission, sans jamais s'embarrasser des mécaniques de survie ou de [i]scoring[/i] du jeu.

Comme les derniers [i]powerups[/i] débloqués sont beaucoup plus puissants que les autres, il ne sert à rien d'essayer d'obtenir un bon score avant d'avoir fini toute cette collecte laborieuse, qui n'a strictement aucun sens sur Steam ou sur consoles: au moins, sur téléphones et tablettes, ce système où l'on cherche à faire perdre le maximum de temps au joueur est pertinent puisqu'on l'arrose constamment de publicités dans l'intervalle, mais puisque ici le joueur a payé le jeu une bonne fois pour toute, ces simagrées sont inutiles et massacrent un jeu qui serait très bon sans elles. Le pire, c'est qu'une fois qu'on a enfin débloqué les derniers [i]powerups,[/i] le [i]scoring[/i] est soudain déséquilibré à cause de la surpuissance de ces [i]powerups,[/i] la survie devenant trop facile et les parties trop longues, jouer s'approchant alors plus d'un test d'endurance monotone que de la tension d'un jeu à scores.

Il y a de toute façon trop de [i]powerups,[/i] beaucoup d'entre eux étant redondants, inutiles ou (donc) trop puissants. C'est vraiment dommage, car en ne gardant que les cinq nouveaux [i]powerups[/i] les plus pertinents et les plus équilibrés (le laser, la bombe, le feu, les pièges et l'aimant) puis en supprimant toutes ces stupides mécaniques de déblocage, et enfin en rendant disponibles tous les [i]powerups[/i] dès le début et en les mettant directement dans le labyrinthe sans sélection comme dans un vrai jeu d'arcade, Pac-Man 256 serait excellent, un nouveau classique.

Pour encore aggraver les choses, les tableaux de scores en ligne sont honteux, n'affichant que les 100 premiers scores en plus du nôtre, sans que l'on puisse avoir la moindre idée de notre classement par rapport à l'ensemble des joueurs.

J'ai conscience que cette évaluation est assez longue, mais les avantages et les inconvénients du jeu sont difficiles à expliquer brièvement, et le jeu m'a captivé en dépit de l'épouvantable gâchis que représente la boucherie de sa transition depuis les téléphones et tablettes. Avec quelques ajustements mineurs, j'aurais recommandé ce jeu avec enthousiasme.

38631805.review:
Попсово-аркадный закос под Пакмана.

С Пакманом, точнее его клоном, я познакомился на «динозавре» под названием [url=https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%94%D0%B8%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%BE%D0%B3%D0%BE%D0%B2%D1%8B%D0%B9_%D0%B2%D1%8B%D1%87%D0%B8%D1%81%D0%BB%D0%B8%D1%82%D0%B5%D0%BB%D1%8C%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9_%D0%BA%D0%BE%D0%BC%D0%BF%D0%BB%D0%B5%D0%BA%D1%81]ДВК[/url]. Это не он. 

Это быстрая аркада, в которую можно играть как в тетрис, то есть бесконечное число раз и всё равно проигрывать.  Смысл отсутствует, но кому какой дело, когда весело! Тут нет как в классическом Pac-man цели «съесть» все точки на экране — тут вас постоянно гонят вперёд, рассыпая на пути разного рода усилители. Каждый раунд можно выбрать тройку бонусов, которые будут скидывать наиболее часто. Новые бонусы можно открывать, съедая точки, и усиливать, выполняя задания. То есть стиль игры потихоньку, но меняется. Цвет врагов соотвествует разным моделям агрессивного поведения. В игре доступен пяток разнообразных «шкурок», так что если не нравятся приведения, то их можно поменять на машинки или стулья. 

Звук я сразу выключил — думаю ничего не потерял.

38583745.review:
This isn't pac-man, it's some weird parody of the original. The maze litterally never ends (there's just one infinite level). You don't clear all the dots (you just get rewarded for chaining together as many in a row as possible). And you don't even get multiple lives (just one, die and start over).

After an hour of playing I'm not sure what the point is. You seem to unlock things after each death, but the gameplay doesn't really change. You get loot boxes full of coins that don't seem to have a purpose. 

I'd call it a nostalgia trip but it kind of isn't. 

I got this as part of a humble bundle and it's OK. It's probably worth $1 or $2, I think $5 (the regular non sale price) might be a bit steep for how shallow the game is.

I will say it's cheaper than feeding quarters into the original. And the ability to reskin the map into various abstract themes is a cute addition (that adds nothing to the actual gameplay, just appearance change).

If you are looking at the screenshots thinking "hey there's a bunch of different games/maps/mazes", no, there isn't. It's the same infinite map. You pick a theme when you start, it's just a skin change. 

It was neat for about an hour, and whoever made this has a serious grasp on how to make addictive sound effects. But I'm not sure I'll ever put much more time into it than that.

If you need some vague parody of a modern pac-man game, this is it.

Fun, simple game, nice for chilling with music. I'm not the biggest fan of traditional pac-man but I find this pretty good. The progression and mobile game elements feel nice. Compared to the mobile version, this game lacks continues and the hi score cam, but overall the game is the same. The powerups overall feel all the same (at least the first half you unlock), but this comes from this needing to be a simple mobile game. As on PC you have buttons, a jump powerup (like from pac-mania), dash pads (like from pac man arrangement) and other things would have made nice additions.

Loot box system in game could've been more interesting (unbox powerup upgrades, continues, reskins, dot progression for powerups)

Overall the game is fun but you can feel this is a mobile port and if they had "PC-ified" it and added more, it could have made the game even more fun.

36649919.review:
I played this in a 4 player group for the first time and was pleasantly surprised by the multiplayer mode. It's not totally co-op, because you are battling for points, but you also resurrect each other and share power-ups: when one player grabs a laser, everyone gets to use it. By watching each other's backs and co-operating, you can make much more progress.

True it's repetitive, and lacks depth, but compare that to original arcade Pac-Man and there's plenty of fun to be had. Plus, lots of unlockables and missions to keep you coming back for more.

Pro-Tip: each colour of ghost has a different type of move. Some have a set route, some will constantly chase you, and others have their own patterns. Learn to predict where they'll go.

36452901.review:
[h1] PACMAN 256 est malheureusement bien loin d'être un bon jeu, même pour 5 €. En quelques minutes de ce jeu, j'en suis complétement blazé car bien trop répétitif et pauvre à la fois. Cela ressemble plus à un jeu mobile, de qualité il faut le reconnaître, mais qui devrait avant tout être destiné au mobile. Parce que là ...[/h1]

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1198397918

Le jeu est beau il faut le reconnaître, puis les idées novatrices sont assez sympathique. C'est plutôt un Pacman endless, dans le sens ou il n y a réellement pas de fin, car on ne s'en tient pas au " tableau " bien célèbre avec ce nombre déterminé de pièces à gober. Là, il faut tout simplement en gober le plus, avant de se faire avaler par un fantôme, ou pire encore par la map qui disparait. Le jeu s'appuie sur une diagonale ( c'est assez inconfortable d'ailleurs ), avec un plateau qui s'efface progressivement du bas vers le haut. Le but étant de se frayer un chemin tout en évitant les fantomes qui sont très nombreux, et qui gagnent de la rapidité au fil de la montée. C'est là le principal problème, finis le jeu de reflexe ou les personnages vont à peu près à même vitesse. Ici, il faut jouer sur le play et retry, c'est-à-dire faire une centaine de parties en ramassant le plus possible de pièces pour pouvoir améliorer le powerup du petit Puckman, afin qu'il puisse grimper dans le niveau sans se faire surpasser par le fantôme, sauf que c'est sans fin, il faut faire plein de parties car que vous soyez bon ou non à ce jeu, impossible d'aller, c'est frustrant.

Bien heureusement, les éditeurs ne vous proposent pas encore ( pour l'instant ) de payer pour améliorer votre bonhomme plus vite. Pour décrire le style de jeu, ça ressemble un peu à Crossy Road ( jeu mobile ) et je me demande franchement ce que fait ce jeu sur Steam ... Ca n'a pas sa place, ou il devrait être gratuit avec achats intégrés.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1198397818

Je voudrais aussi faire remarquer que lorsque j'avais acheté le jeu il y'a quelques mois, il y'avait une mention qui précisait que Pacman 256 était multijoueur " En ligne ". Bien évidemment, les éditeurs ont fait comme beaucoup d'autre la " bagatelle de mettre cette mention " puisque évidemment c'est bien plus vendeur ... Je vous dis pas ma surprise lorsque j'ai lancé le multijoueur que le jeu me proposait de connecter des manettes à mon ordinateur ! Mais je ne suis pas plus étonné. Ca vaut pas réellement le coup donc, après il peut-être sympa si vous avez l'opportunité de jouer à plusieurs sur un seul et mêm ordinateur ( ce que je trouve débile, mais bon c'est un peu partout ). 
Un véritable mode multijoueur en ligne ne serait pas de trop en tout les cas !

35267635.review:
[h1]Genius![/h1]

Another new spin on Pac-Man that is really clever, and one of those ideas that I wonder why this hadn't been done already.

Pac-Man, as usual, is about mazes, dots, and ghosts. The formula is so perfect that for generations it has just worked as a pure arcade experience. It has been toyed with to varying degrees of success, but my favorites to this day had always only been Ms. Pac-Man, Pac-Mania, and Pac-Man Championship Edition.

Then along comes PAC-MAN 256, and I have myself another favorite game in the series.

PAC-MAN 256 is about outrunning the ever-encroaching glitch; a series of scrambled characters crawling up from the bottom end of the maze. To do this you must chomp dots, avoid ghosts, and race through an endless randomly generated maze that goes on forever. I've never gotten too far into the maze, but as far as I know it doesn't end.

A really cool feature is that the maze isn't the same experience twice, and it will take skill more than memorization to endure. Along the way you have a plethora of power-ups, and skillful players are rewarded with a maze-clearing 256 bonus.

[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
    [*]High replay value
    [*]Tight controls
    [*]Customizable power-ups
    [*]Mazes go on for as long as you can
    [*]Customizable maze themes
[/list]

[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Thumping intro music gets annoying
[/list]

[b]Verdict: 10/10[/b]

Procedurally generated Pac-Man was a stroke of genius. Totally worth your time!

35045851.review: Great game. It plays like an endless runner, but still feels 100% Pac Man. Your goal is to flee from an unstoppable glitch wall, but the maze of dots has ghosts, fruit and powerups littered around to keep things interesting. Powerups allow you to customise your playstyle slightly (some are great for clearing ghosts, and others like stealth are useful for making distance quickly since you can essentially ignore the ghosts altogether for the duration). You only have three slots but there are a ton to choose from, and after hitting total-dots-eaten milestones more will become available. It'll take a while to get everything opened up. Thankfully there are no microtransactions or ads to sit through to unlock anything, just play and they'll roll in. I love how each colour of ghost has their own behaviour, and will react reliably. There's very little down to chance, so with enough practice you can reliably get big scores. If you like Pac Man it's easy to spend a lot of time trying to beat your personal best.

34888950.review:
[h1]Описание:[/h1]
Очередные приключения желтого колобка путешествующего по лабиринту и пожирающего белые точки. На этот раз нам представлена вариация бесконечного лабиринта, который подвергся атаке злобного вируса. Вирус постепенно сжигает лабиринт, а значит нам нужно стараться двигаться все время вверх. При этом призраки не медлят и тоже жаждут слопать нашего колобка. В помощь нам представлена огромная куча оружия и бонусов, которые неплохо скрашивают игровой процесс и позволяют пробиться сквозь полчища врагов. После каждой попытки пройти уровень мы получаем монетки, а также увеличиваем прогресс открытия нового оружия, на который вышеупомянутые монетки и тратятся. Способны ли вы побить все рекорды и дойти как можно дальше?

[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
¥ Возможность использовать до трех бонусных предметов, которые будут разбросаны по лабиринту и будут помогать нашему колобку. При этом предметы представлены довольно в большом количестве и открываются по мере прохождения, а также улучшаются за собранные монеты.
¥ В игре присутствуют задания (сбор определенных фруктов, бонусов).
¥ Несколько различных вариаций оформления пекмана (меняется фон, враги, декорации, фрукты и колобок).

[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
¥ Полное отсутствие саундтрека. В меню повизгивает мелодия, а в самой игре музыки вообще нет.
¥ Сделали возможность играть вчетвером за одним компом... Вот только один человек сможет играть на клавиатуре, а всем остальным нужны джойстики (пришлось подключать ради ачивки).
¥ Достижения. Для получения всех ачивок вам будет нужен джойстик, а также куча времени и нервов, чтобы открыть все бонусы и улучшить их до максимума.
¥ Рекорды друзей. Нам постоянно будут показываться рекорды наших друзей, которые мы побиваем, но они никуда не уходят и вновь отображаются каждый раз сбоку.

[h1]Итог:[/h1]
Самая нудная и скучная версия пекмана из тех, что мне доводилось видеть. А переиграл я почти во все выпущенные. Видно, что игра разрабатывалась для мобильных устройств и для ПК её не достаточно адоптировали. Часик-два погонять еще интересно, а дальше нудный фарм монет и точек... Помогают только длительные перерывы между игровыми сессиями... Не рекомендую.

[h1]Оценка: 5/10[/h1]

[h1]Послесловие:[/h1]
Если вам понравился этот обзор добро пожаловать в группу
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компании.

34753314.review:
I gotta admit: if it wasn't for the humble bundle it came in, I never would've bought this. The screenshots, videos and the familiar gameplay (c'mon: you, reader, have already played a pac-man game at one point in your life. Admit it!) seemed nice, but pretty samey. And after pac-man championship (which was basicaly pac-man on crack in terms of speed), I didn't think much of this.

But I was wrong. As the screens suggest, this is actually an endless runner. You no longer have to collect all the dots but just attempt to stay alive long enough. You can't hide because there's a glitch-thing eating the maze, but you can collect dots that'll determine your score, and money to save for power-up upgrades (that have only a marginal effect on the game). This game is like a snack: you don't go around playing pac-man 256 the entire night, but it's a pretty great timewaster.

34573076.review:
An evoloution in the pac-man series this game is just as addicting as the original.
But what makes this game so addicting you ask?
To put it simply its chasing the numbered dragon, its all about the chase of that score its exciting its got all the elements of a good arcade game. It's easy to learn, hard to master and even harder to walk away from.

dont just collect the power pelets collect power ups and traps.
There are 2 types of power up attacking and stealth. you can eat a power pellet to eat the ghosts or become giant and squash them of even zap them with lazers.
there is a stealth power up that makes ghosts invisible and you can pass through them.
But what fun are these power ups unless you can upgrade them to make them last sooo much longer. 

Another cool point is you can change your maze and charecters from the classic style pac-man, to  my personal favriot pac mania as i loved this game on the master system, all the wayto the neon glow of the championship edition even that hit indie kids game crossy roads yes thats right your a chicken and you have to avoid ghosts dressed as cars.  

Where this game really shines is is local co op where up to 4 players can sit round and join in the mayhem
either 2 players on a key bord and 2 controllers or grab 4 controllers and slouch on the couch and  chase the numbered dragon together.

In short Pac-man 256 is a port of one of them endless runner type of games on your mobile phones that  don't suck. 
I would recomend this to seasoned pac-maners who look for another way to get there fix  or who is new to pac-man.

33820648.review:
This feels poorly designed just looking at the infinite runner aspect of the gameplay and ignoring that Pac Man has been slapped into it.

Though the game is visually appealing(for, you know, a mobile port that originally wasn’t supposed to keep your attention for more than 5 minutes), there are a few game play elements that are hard to dissect in a quick, life/death situation.  The glitchy teleport effect is shared between randomly placed coins and glitched ghosts.  Both will show up randomly, but coins are a semi-frequent pickup that are crucial to progression when starting out, where as ghosts will of course kill you if you try and run through their teleport assuming it was a coin about to pop up.  The only difference I could see between their visual effect is that ghosts took about half a second longer to make the transition.  You already don’t get much time to judge what it is because of the corridor hallways the map is made out of and the 256 wall doesn’t allow for too much back tracking should you need to find a better path.

Power ups are horribly designed/balanced.  I should point out that if not all your power ups are lethal(as in a weapon of some sort), you will guarantee your death in multiple situations early in a run.  Not even pickups that give you non-lethal invincibility are useful. They can leave you trapped when they wear off and won’t earn you any extra points anyway.

While achievement hunting, I discovered that after awhile, the hallway setups and ghost placements become exceedingly predictable.  Its when I noticed that power ups are usually placed in areas in later parts of a run where they are absolutely necessary to progress through an area.  If you choose anything other than an all lethal loadout, you will either die within the area or not progress fast enough and screw yourself in the near future.

Many unlockable pick ups have straight upgrades with the only nerfs being less points for using them and less time given when picking them up.  This becomes entirely trivial when the better form of the same pick up is significantly more useful and will extend your game much further than using the longer lasting/better scoring pick up.  A grand example of this is the beam/laser pick up, with the Beam pick up reflecting off corners and being able to clear out large groups of ghosts without being anywhere near them.  The score/time bonus for using the inferior laser doesn’t even come close to being relevant, as it can’t kill ghosts without direct line of sight and is still vulnerable in many situations that the beam is not.

The periodic missions that give you coins as a reward for completing them often pressure players into doing things that would probably get them killed, so to progress and level up powers, you will have to sacrifice trying to play towards an actual score like you would expect in an arcade game, or even an infinite runner.  The coin rewards are also random and have nothing to do with what the mission objective was.  Though the objectives can take anywhere from the first 3 minutes of a run collecting a small amount of pellets to multiple runs searching for 6 of the exact same fruit, you can get anywhere between 128 and 1024 coins for doing them.  From my experience, it went more towards the low end of rewards more often than not.

All of this is just bad gameplay.  THEN you add the fact that it has a Pac Man theme, a game series with deep roots to classic, skill based arcade experiences, and that this started out as F2P mobile game… yeah its a pretty big slap to the face.  I would like to give them credit for making a solid port but honestly I don’t think many people would play something like this on PC, its really unnecessary.  I wouldn’t play this on mobile either, despite having mobile games ranging from both casual and a bit more in depth.  Pac Man 256 is just a bad game in general, and a pointless addition to anyone’s Steam library.

'길건너 친구들'의 개발사인 Hipster Whale에서 개발한 오리지널 팩맨과 약간은 다른 로그라이트 느낌의 팩맨입니다.

본 게임은 미리 정해진 닫힌 맵에서 플레이하는 것이 아니라, '길건너 친구들'처럼 랜덤하게 생성되는 지도를 따라 윗쪽 방향으로 무한히 진행하게 됩니다. 진행 중에 플레이어는 다양한 파워업 아이템으로 위기를 모면하거나 유령들을 학살하게 되는데, 우리가 흔히 팩맨에서 보아 왔던 'power pellet' 외에도 수십여 종의 아이템이 준비되어 있어 오랜 시간 즐기기에 부족함이 없습니다. 동전을 모아 좋아하는 아이템을 레벨업 하면서 점점 더 어려운 도전에 직면하는 스릴을 맛보게 되지요.

유령들은 자신의 색깔에 따라 미리 정해진 행동 패턴을 갖고 움직이기 때문에 플레이어는 맵의 구조를 바탕으로 유령들의 행동을 예측하며 위기를 모면하는 등 지능적 플레이를 즐길 수 있습니다. 그러면서도 '붉은 유령'에게는 단순한 패턴이 아닌 좀 더 똑똑한 움직임을 부여하여 자칫하면 느슨해질 수 있는 게임에 좋은 자극을 주고 있습니다.

그 외에도 간단하게나마 퀘스트('무엇'을 '몇 개' 먹으시오 등)가 제공되어, 이를 해결하게 되면 랜덤한 수량의 동전을 받는 보상 시스템이 존재하기 때문에 게임을 단순한 생존이나 하이 스코어 달성 외의 목적으로도 플레이할 여지를 주고 있습니다.

같이 플레이할 친구나 가족이 있다면 로컬 코옵 기능도 대단히 재미있습니다. 유령에게 죽은 같은 편 팩맨을 살릴 수 있기 때문에 전우애랄지, 나도 모르게 친구를 응원하고 있는 자신을 발견하게 됩니다.

지금까지 말씀드린 장점에도 불구하고, 이 게임의 메커니즘 자체는 근본적으로 단순하기 때문에 아주 오래 플레이하기에는 조금 무리가 있다고 생각합니다. 적당히 캐쥬얼하게 즐기면 좋을 것 같습니다. 저는 마지막 도전 과제인 '모든 파워업을 최대로 레벨 업 하기'를 달성하기 위해 이 게임에 정이 떨어지기 일보 직전까지 노가다를 했는데, 여러분께 권하고 싶지는 않네요 ㅡ.ㅡㅋ

33484538.review:
It's OK. When taken on its own and not held to any of its predecessors.

The problem there is, I've already seen what a modern Pac-Man game could be with CEDX+. When held up to that candle, this game falls short in just about every measure.

The various power ups start out interesting, and then either become obsolete (what is the use of choosing or upgrading Laser/Bomb/Freeze/Tornado/Fire/Magnet, when you have Optics/Boom/Shatter/Twinado/Pyro/Regen, which are respectively similar but more powerful versions?), or are pretty useless (Sonar) or unwieldy (Radar) compared to other power ups.

The incentive to actually get a high score is lacking. The game quickly becomes a grind about collecting coins to boost power-ups, and even with that, you will get far more coins from completing missions or just as free drops between games than you will actually playing the game.

Speaking of missions, in part these seem to be used as a crutch to make sure that you give every powerup, no matter how useless, fair air time. Because, eventually, you WILL get missions for things like "collect 5 Sonar power ups", and the only way to do that is to equip the power up so that it appears in the game, consuming one of your precious 3 slots. Ugh.

The game also breaks several traditional Pac-Man conventions. Forget about the tight, ghost-escaping cornering that you may have relied upon SINCE 1980, because the ghosts in this game will catch you every time. You will absolutely need to unlearn that to do any good at this game.  The fruit progression is not even correct, even among the paltry 5 fruits they included in the game, causing me to instinctually overvalue some fruits and undervalue others.

I'm a little under halfway through the grind to max out all power-ups (at 9h), and frankly, I'm not sure I'll find the motivation to continue to completion.  This seemed like it might be a good 100%'er, but that hope is fading fast.

If you want a good, modern Pac-Man game, get CEDX+.  If you already have CEDX+, play it some more.  It's more exciting, more authentic to the original, and just MORE in general than this game is.  I'm not saying that this game NEEDED to be just as good as CEDX+, but it certainly could learn a couple of things from CEDX+ in order to actually be good.

33294455.review:
(I'm going to assume that you know what Pac Man is. If not, watch a Youtube video or something! Pac Man is undeniably one of the most important and iconic video games in history.)

Pac Man 256 is a very well done, procedurally generated, dot eating maze game. The level scrolls infinititely upward, and the entire time you are chased by a slow-moving kill wall that forces your continuous ascent.

Unlike the old Pac Man games, the objective isn't to eat ALL the dots you see... There's simply not enough time to do that, and you'll get killed pretty quickly. Rather, you now simply have to eat as many dots (and classic power pellets) as you can as you keep going up, all while avoiding ghosts and collecting fruit (which are now multipliers) along the way.

In addition to the standard dots/ghosts/fruit, there are powerups and coins scattered throughout the maze. Collecting a powerup gives Pac Man a temporary power, such as the ability to slow ghosts down, or kill them from a distance in various ways. The coins serve as an ingame currency, which you can use to permanently upgrade your powerups between games. Powerups are unlocked simply by eating dots over your career, and you're allowed to pick 3 of them at a time to randomly appear throughout the maze. I've only unlocked a few of the powerups so far, but they all seem to work well with the game, and it's been fun to see what new power the game will throw at me next.

Just like the Championship Edition, this game is a great modern take on a classic game. It's sleek, it's polished, and it gets frenetic. It changes enough to be a new and exciting experience, but it still retains the classic features and basic gameplay that make it distinctly Pac Man. There's still that age old arcade-y drive to play again and beat your high score, while the progression system and powerup leveling mean that even short bursts of this game are enjoyable.

On top of that, this game is super cheap, even at regular price. Highly recommended.

33107585.review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]

Pacman 256 is an endless arcade maze game.

+ Very polished
+ Very addicting
+ Calm sound design
+ Many interesting power ups
+ Many themes

[h1]Review[/h1]

The first thing you will notice is that this is not the original Pacman. The game is an endless maze where you must avoid ghosts and the glitch tsunami. Interestingly the glitch tsunami is based in the original Pacman's level 256 glitch: the screen gets split into two with the right side turning into a soup of numbers and letters. The 256 level of Pacman is impossible to beat and occurs due to the level number being stored as an 8-bit number. The highest number and 8-bit number can store is 255 (2^8 - 1 = 255) so going to level 256 glitches the game. This glitch is also the origin of this game's name. Being an arcade game the objective is to reach the maximum score. To get points you eat pellets, fruits or kill ghosts by getting power ups

There about 18 power ups available but to use them you must first unlock the power ups with points and you can only choose 3 to show up for sure in each game. A random power up may show up from time to time as a 256 glitch. This random power up is usually the power you're going to unlock next. Some examples of power ups are giant, fire, lava, laser, magnet and so on. As you progress the power ups get more interesting. You can also level up your power ups with the virtual currency you get in the game which will usually increase the duration of the power up. To no surprise there's also the standard power pill that shows up in every game which turns the ghosts blue and allows you to eat the ghosts.

This game is very polished. I didn't find any bug or complication whatsover. It's an easy enough game to just start playing. There's a lot of attention to detail. For example the game tells you how many pellets you ate non stop both with a small non distracting number on the side of pacman and with a faster eating sound the more pellets you get. You also get a score for that particular feat. You also have a very useful bar on top of the screen that tells you how long until your power up ends. You also have missions in each game to help you get currency to level up your power ups and keep you interested. The current mission shows up at the start of each level.

The color of the ghosts tell you which way they'll try to get you. Blue ghosts will just circle around, orange ghosts just randomly travel through the maze, pink ghosts will ram against you when you're found, black ghosts are sleeping until you get close and follow until you get far enough for the ghost go to sleep again and the red ghosts will follow you indefinitely. There are also lines of ghosts. The green line just goes from one side to the other and the purple ghosts follow which side you're on. You need to know these patterns to get better scores.

There are many themes in this game. You can choose one for every game and that's fine if you want to get used to one particular theme but I find it more interesting to just let the game chose one randomly each game. The colors and icons were designed so that you understand what's going on even if you have random themes.

Overall this game is a very addicting and easy to play, just like early arcade games, with a touch of modern features. If you like arcade games this one is definitely a keeper.

[h1]Edit[/h1]

Fixed writting mistakes.

PAC-MAN 256 is a interesting spin on the classic Pac-Man formula, introducing an endless scrolling maze, fun power-ups and local multiplayer. Power-ups can be purchased and upgraded with currency found in the maze during gameplay, and optional quests can speed up the process of getting that currency. On top of all of this, there's also a wide selection of themes that change the graphical appearance of the game.

With all of these features, however, the most important thing is that the gameplay is solid, and the game itself is actually fun to play. It certainly kept me coming back for "one more time" to see how much farther I can push my high score or to unlock the next power-up.

In summary, this is a well-designed spin on an arcade classic, and is a good pick for anyone who would enjoy classic gameplay with a modern twist.

31934997.review:
[h1][b]A pleasant throwback to early gaming[/b][/h1]

[b]Presentation[/b]
Named after the famous level 256 glitch, Pac-Man 256 brings back the best things from the game that changed an entire generation back in the 80s and combines them with new ideas that make this game just as addictive as it was in the arcades decades ago. Played from a 2.5D perspective, the biggest feature of this installment is the 256 bit glitch that will constantly follow you from the bottom of the screen, making time an important element of the game, as you can no longer dance around the same spot for too long and must constantly be on the move to avoid the glitch catching up with you. Unfortunately there are only 2 game modes, a single player mode, and a multiplayer mode for up to 4 players via local play, but even with that in mind, Pac-Man's addictive nature will make the hours pass without even realizing, especially when playing with friends. 

As much as I loved playing alone and collect more coins to upgrade my power-ups, the real fun begins when up to 3 other friends join you for a local multiplayer session, something that few games in this age even consider, and Pac-Man 256 does that so well. As the glitch will constantly follow you, sticking around for too long is not an option, which means that players cannot be too far apart, making multiplayer on a single screen feel natural and the movement fluid. There is no split-screen needed and all you need to do is pass another controller to a friend and you're playing together on one single large screen; fast forward one hour later and you will still be there trying to beat the high score.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
This is still Pac-Man in every possible way, but the new features, power-ups and tweaks to the formula make it feel like a fresh experience, and thanks to 21 different power-ups there is a lot to play around with. Each power-up can be upgraded with coins in order to increase duration and finding the best combination to suit your play style is the key to success, as you can only equip 3 power-ups at a time, which means that once inside the match only the selected power-ups will spawn, in addition to the famous Power Pellet. 

Even if at its core multiplayer mode is still the same thing, the fact that you can respawn other downed players makes matches much longer, and once you and your friends get that perfect combination of momentum and power-ups, you will constantly push for a bigger high score, which is pretty much all you have going on since there are no additional modes, but do not underestimate the power of leaderboards, as the desire to make it to the top feels just as genuine now as it did back in the 80s. 

In terms of enemies you will still have to face Blinky, Inky, Pinky, and Clyde, in addition to their new friend Glitchy, each one of them having a unique AI pattern that you must learn first in order to succeed. Even though there is no tutorial to teach you which ghost follows which pattern if you aren't familiar with Pac-Man already, just playing a few matches should teach you that in a matter of minutes. Same thing applies to power-ups and trying them all before deciding on the three that best fit your play style is just as important, as players who prefer avoiding the ghosts might find the Freeze power-up more useful than the Laser for example, which is aimed towards the players that aim to eliminate every single ghosts in their path.

[b]Graphics[/b]
Even if the resolution and design quality are obviously better than they were back in the arcades, Pac-Man 256 still has an 8 bit style, but with a large number of skins inspired by previous installments in the Pac-Man franchise, you can choose the one that catches your eye and just go with that. However, skins don't change the overall layout of the map or the play style in any way, and are made purely for aspect purposes. 

[b]Audio[/b]
Sound is just as your remember it, with a better quality of course, but all the death sounds and pac munches are still the same, which definitely helps with the nostalgia element this game wants to pass along to the player. There are obviously new sounds made for the power-ups, and they fit nicely with the rest of the sounds that probably any kid who grew up playing Pac-Man could recognize in an instant. 

[b]Extras[/b]
Sadly, whether you choose to play alone or with friends locally, that one mode is all you get, however playing with power-ups and collecting coins to max out each one of them and unlock all of the achievements can keep you busy for 20 hours at least. Skins are a nice addition, but apart from changing the aspect, they don't change anything to the gameplay itself. 

[b]Verdict[/b]
Pac-man 256 is a pleasant throwback to the times when video games used to be much more simple, yet still entertaining at the same time and reminds us why Pacman is still one of the most influential video games of all time, decades later still managing to be as addictive and fun as it was when it first came out.
[u]Rating: 8.4[/u]

[h1][b]Check out the full review at [url=http://gamedragons.net/viewtopic.php?f=33&t=199&p=196]GameDragons.Net[/url][/b][/h1]

31375844.review:
It's a solid mobile port and a good reimagination of a Pac-Man game. PAC-MAN 256 offers just enough change from the original classic that it comes across as a fresh interpretation without renouncing its core mechanic.

The idea is to turn the 256 glitch of the original game into an ever looming threat that creeps up from the bottom of the screen, chasing the player and thus transforming this iteration of the classic into an infinite runner. It's a great game to play for a few minutes or a means to occupy your hands while listening to music or podcasts as it doesn't feature any background music. The familiar "waka waka" along with other retro sound effects are still there though.

The game draws from a pool of premade level sections where the paths and placement of the ghosts are set. Learning the level sets, ghost placements and most notably the ghost movement patterns gives the player the opportunity to improve and make decisions based on empirical knowledge. Countering the possible repetitiveness, new power ups can be unlocked and different themes activated.

PAC-MAN 256 doesn't reinvent the wheel but offers a short and fun arcade session close to the original.

31276764.review:
Pac man is back with added variety and some fun twists; the game doesn't stray too far away from the original pac man experience.

You get to collect dots and evade ghosts as usual, but this time around the game comes in one big endless level that gets harder as you move foreward. Behind you, a glitch is eating up the world at a moderate pace, so you need to keep moving. You play with a different viewing angle than the original pac man, and the game rewards you for collecting dots in long un-interrupted chains.

As you play, you will unlock some power ups, and can and upgrade them with coins that you find, or get from completing some objectives.

The true hero of the game is the multiplayer, which supports up to 4 players on the same pc, and this adds a lot of replayability. The game also allows you to choose from different background designs, and different shapes for your pac-man. Without multiplayer expect to play around 10 hours if you want to experience everything the game has to offer, and collect all acheivements.

I haven't encountered any bugs or game slow downs as I played, and the game size is very light on the hard disk (just under 100mb).

___________________
What I think could have been improved is how the acheivements are structured, not much thought was put into the acheivements, and there are many missed oportunities.

To illustrate this, one of the achievements requires you to fully upgrade all power ups, it is not very hard to do but it requires lots of grinding, you will most probably complete all other acheivements way before this one, and it can possibly be your only remaining motive to play, most players just quit, as this acheivement only has about a 1.5% completion rate at the time of this writting.

Instead, this objective could have been lowered to upgrade all power ups to level 7, with additional acheivements for fully upgrading some of the powerups, or for using a specific combo of powerups in a single game and acheiving a high score, or for maintaining a powerup's active time for an elongated period of time, or for completing some of the objectives in a single game.

Un juego de este tipo es bueno cuando entre el 'vale una más', el 'ahora ya lo dejo' y 'de verdad que ésta es la última' hay un montón de partidas y la extraña sensación de que el mando se ha quedado adherido a tus manos.

Es un juego muy divertido que capta la esencia básica del Pacman a la que le añade el modo 'infinito' y una serie de desafíos simples pero bien desarrollados que hacen que cada partida sea un pequeño reto. Desde cuantas bolas puedes zamparte de forma ininterrumpida hasta lo lejos que llegues en puntuación pasando por los mini-retos específicos (usar cinco veces el huracán, matar x fantasmas con el láser). Todo eso hace que siendo siempre el mismo juego la sensación sea distinta y siempre divertida, de competir contra uno mismo.

Tiene un modo multijugador en el mismo ordenador que estoy seguro de que tiene que ser muy divertido durante una fiesta pero que, por el momento, no he podido probar todavía. 

Un título que puede pasar desapercibido pero que me parece muy recomendable.

31036578.review:
[i]Dommage qu'il ne s'appelle plus PUC-MAN...[/i]

[b]PAC-MAN 256[/b], sorti en 2016 et développé par les créateurs de [b]Crossy Road[/b] (un jeu pour smartphone), est un Endless-Runner (sorti aussi sur smartphone) où l'on incarne le célèbre mangeur de boules (je sens que je vais rapidement regretter cette appellation). Le portage PC du jeu smartphone est-il réussi ?

[h1]Les plus :[/h1]

- Ils ont respecté la musique originale, donc un bon point.
- Le jeu s'inspire du bogue du niveau 256 de [b]PAC-MAN[/b], où l'écran se barre en cacahuètes dès le niveau 256. Votre but dans cette version étant de fuir ce bogue, donc assez sympa comme référence.
- Gameplay simple, sans fioritures. Vous avez des power-ups afin de pimenter un peu le jeu, et on les améliore via l'argent gagné en jeu.
- Plusieurs "skins" du jeu. Vous avez la classique, la "Crossy Road", etc...

[h1]Les moins :[/h1]

- Mis à part un level sans-fin, il n'y a rien. Ce qui est dommage, ils auraient pu faire d'autres modes à côté.
- Un multi... mais en local.

[h1]Conclusion :[/h1]

[b]PAC-MAN 256[/b] est un bon petit jeu d'arcade, vous occupant quelques heures, ou beaucoup plus si vous cherchez le 100% succès. Sans prétention, il saura vous combler et raviver quelques souvenirs d'enfance chez certains. A prendre en solde.

_ _ _ _

30927532.review:
What is Pac-Man for you? For me - it's a [b]legend[/b]. You collect dots and try to escape from evil monsters known as "ghosts".

[b]Why choose PAC-MAN 256 amongst all other Pac-mans on Steam?[/b] - there are lots of different answers to it, and I'll start by listing them:
[list]
[*] PAC-MAN 256 does not go far from original Pac-man, unlike some other Pac-mans on Steam.
[*] It has various power-ups which make game more interesting. Getting new power-ups and upgrading them takes decent amount of time, so you don't have to worry about game being very easy or too hard to advance.
[*] Backgrounds/themes. You might not like to play on same background again and again. PAC-MAN 256 has feature to change your background theme - you can either use theme from original Pac-Man or change one for each round.
[*] Multiplayer. Although it's called "multiplayer", it's actually old styled multiplayer. And what's that? - It's 2 player game mode on same keyboard. It's a thing I, personally, [b]love[/b].
[*] Windows XP support! Guess what? - most of the Pac-mans on Steam does not support WinXP. What of it? - Pac-man was released in 1980, so it just makes me feel good when I see WinXP or earlier in support requirements' tab. [spoiler]I actually tested game on WinXP (SP3). It works very well![/spoiler]
[/list]

[b]"Game's not as perfect as you describe, right?"[/b] - you'll ask. Of course not... There are some minuses to PAC-MAN 256.
First of all, this so called "glich" was a very disapointment for me when I first launched game. There's not enough description on store page, so people will most likely be confused when they discover that there's something coming from bottom to "eat" you... But it's [b]must have[/b] feature for PAC-MAN 256! It is what makes game different from other ones. Here's what I suggest: find someone from your household or neighbourhood who's crazy for Pac-man (just like me) and start playing together. You'll have unlimited amount of fun forever - as long as you don't intend to play a game for few hours a day (playing any game for few hours straight ruins fun in my opinion, for 2/3 of games, at least).

[b]Anything that PAC-MAN 256 does not have?[/b] - there ar things, of course. For example - there's not big choise of background themes (at least for me). 
Is missing "feature" problem for PAC-MAN 256? - I don't think so. Devs are working hard for game and are making updates regulary.

30917071.review:
[h1]Description[/h1]

Pac-Man 256 is a Pac-Man reboot that does not wander as far away from the original as Pac-Man Championship Edition did. The view has been tilted weirdly (as if you were looking over the shoulder of someone playing the original Pac-Man), a ton of skins and powerups (which are unlocked and upgraded via coins collected in-game) have been introduced and the game forces you to move on constantly by destroying the level behind you as time goes by. Apart from those tweaks, it is very much a classic Pac-Man game.
The weird name is probably a reference to the weird obsession with the powers of 2 in the progress system. You need 2, then 4, then 8 and all the way up to 2048 coins to upgrade a power fully. Unless of course it really is the 256th opus in the franchise... Could be, for all I know.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*] Classic Pac-Man gameplay
[*] Procedurally generated levels alleviate repetitivity somewhat
[*] Quest system gives something to focus on and pushes to try all powerups eventually
[*] Great variety of ghost behaviors
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*] Titled view takes some getting used to
[*] Some skins are harder to read than others
[*] Retro sounds that might be grating for some and almost no music
[*] Progress system requires a LOT of mindless grinding to upgrade all powers (which is required for an achievement)
[/list]

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

If you loved the classic Pac-Man and played it a lot, chances are you'll have a good time on this game. You'll surely find what you enjoyed in the old classic, with just enough tweaks to discover new things and to have to rethink old strategies and rewire old reflexes.
If you never enjoyed Pac-Man or only its frantic Championship Edition flavor, stay away from this game.

30867457.review:
PAC-MAN 256 is a great take on the series that's also quite addictive. Unlike the original game, you make progress by continually moving up the screen rather than trying to clear all of the dots in a given area. The goal is to reach the highest score possible, and you'll do that by eating ghosts, collecting power-ups and making combos of up to 256 dots. Getting a 256 combo can be quite challenging; ghosts (many of which behave in different ways) will try to stop your progress, and like in the original game you'll have to either avoid them or eat them with power pellets. 

The game works well with either a keyboard or a controller. There are also different level skins unlocked from the get go, which include ones themed after previous Pac-man games, such as the Championship Edition series. There's also Steam leaderboard support for both highest score and number of 256 combos. Unlocking and upgrading the various power ups will serve as incentive to keep playing, but I found chasing higher scores was more than enough of a reason to return. 

PAC-MAN 256 is well worth checking out!

PAC-MAN 256 is an endless arcade version of the classic pac-man formula with a twist, which is the glitch that is slowly consuming the area starting from the bottom.  Hence, you have to run away from the glitch in addition to the different coloured ghosts.

There are 14 different maps that looks different aesthetically (but all plays the same as there is only one game mode) but more maps might be added in the future as this game is still being supported and updated by the developer despite being almost a year old.

This game can get boring after playing for awhile as there are no story elements or real objective to drive you to play more. The only motivation is to collect dots to unlock new powerups and coins to upgrade the powerups. The required amount of dots and coins to upgrade and unlock all the power-ups are insanely high and you are required to grind through the game alot of times in order to use new power-ups or the upgraded version of them.

However, the game is still fun in small doses, but I believe there are still better games out there to spent your time on. I would recommend this game to Pac-Man fans as it is still a good game but the grinding element is really a turn off for me. If I were to rate this game, I would give it a 6/10!

30575144.review:
I wanted more Championship Edition, but what I got was child's edition. 

It's mobile-game style endless Pac-Man, which means grinding one randomized, endless level for coins to buy upgrades to use in that level, rinse and repeat. But even compared to other rubbish mobile games, Pac-Man 256 is boring. At least in Jetpack Joyride the upgrades make the game feel different, and the scenery changes. 

I would rather play Pac-Man 1 for a few reasons: 

- It had levels, so something to aim for, something to discover. 
- It had lives, and as that supply dwindled, and you risked getting kicked back to the start, the game got more intense. In 256 one hit kills you, and you are supposed to die at some point anyway, so you can deposit your bloody coins, which takes quite a bit of the excitement of progressing out of it.
- The maps didn't go on forever, so it wasn't just about dodging a ghost once, but what you did after that, and after that. Sometimes you had to exploit the ghost's AI to escape, such as scaring away Clyde or confusing Pinky. That's what Pac-Man was all about, for me, so this game doesn't even get nostalgia points because it ♥♥♥♥s it up. 

So after 255 sequels this series has actually gotten worse. 

There is one cool mechanic in 256, actually, which is how as you eat pellets in an unbroken chain, and your combo increases, the sound effect frequency increases, until, after a minute or so, the beat is out of control and it climaxes in a satisfying screen-wiping explosion. It's kind of addictive. But not worth installing the game again.

30566162.review:
[h1]Pac-Man 256 - The endless chomp quest[/h1]

[b]Overview[/b]
Take the classic formula of Pac-Man chowing down on those little white dots and power pellets and turn it into an endless runner. Inspired by the infamous level 256 where due to memory limitations half of the level would glitch out this game has the bottom portion of the screen constantly being eaten up by a glitch forcing you to run away and continue upwards. 

[b]Gameplay[/b]
This game retains the awesome mechanics of the original... Eat, eat, eat and run from ghosts. The original ghosts are all back as well as the addition of a new ghost glitchy. This port from the original does have some changes. They have removed all the microtransactions which is a welcome feature and have added the option to play multiplayer! Co-op play in this is a blast. It gets very tense and if you die your team mate will have the opportunity to revive you. You can work together to unlock new power ups and continue to improve your score.

[b]Graphics[/b]
The graphics are off the hook! you have never seen such cutting edge pixels in your life! it will make your eyes bleed! In all seriousness this is a great presentation. It keeps the feel of the old while updating it and making it feel like something fresh and new. There are several different themes that you can choose from including the developers previous title crossy road.

[b]Conclusion[/b]
All together I think one of the freshest takes on Pac-Man in recent years, and possibly even since its inception. A lot of fun to play in short bursts and true to its source material. I definitely recommend to people looking for a challenge or something as a quick burst of fun that you will keep coming back to.

[h1]5 Pacs out of 5!!![/h1]

30445517.review:
I find the original Pac-Man arcade game no fun, but Pac-Man 256 is LOADS of fun! 

Pac-Man 256 builds its maze procedurally as you nom through the pellets and power-ups, avoiding ghosts and eating them, in alternating phases. What's better is that each type (color) of ghost has a special behavior, so you know what they'll try to do as you approach. If you can swerve accordingly, gaining points, power-ups, etc, I imagine the maze is infinite.

The power-ups are fun, though some are definitely better than others. You can pick up coins in the maze, and earn bonus coins for completing missions (and earn random coin "gift" boxes) that you can spend on leveling up your power-ups. The power-ups have a limited time that can be extended by eating other power-up pellets, in order to chain your power-up to make it last as long as possible. Though the easiest to "chain" is the original Power-Pellet because you also gain extra time for eating ghosts (whereas the other power-ups "kill" them).

I can't recommend this game enough. It's definitely one that will stay installed on my computer for whenever I have downtime or want to unwind.

30398746.review:
Un'interessante reinterpretazione in salsa endless runner del classico Pac-Man. Le meccaniche sono quasi le medesime del gioco originale ma il livello prosegue all'infinito generandosi in maniera procedurale (anche i "set" sono veramente pochi e in breve temppo si imparerà a riconoscerli) e, quindi, l'obiettivo passa dal ripulire il livello al fuggire dal glitch che ci insegue cercando di far salire il punteggio e di evitare i fantasmini.

Fantasmini che troveremo in enormi quantità nel livello e che in maniera un po' infame può capitare che ci attacchino da dei "punti ciechi" al di fuori dello schermo (quelli rosa in particolare) senza poterci difendere efficacemente da loro. Per fortuna in generale il gioco è raramente ingiusto e imparare le caratteristiche dei fantasmi in base al colore è divertente. Per sopravvivere alle orde di fantasmi riceveremo come aiuto, oltre alla classica power pill, anche dei power up dallo stile molto classico (ad esempio: rallentamento nemici, scia infuocata al nostro passaggio, magnete per bonus).

I power up sono forse l'unico punto debole del titolo, non perché mal s'innestano nel sistema di gioco ma perché rivelano la natura furbetta e mobile del gioco. Infatti è possibile far "salire di livello" i vari power up, inutile dire che la progressione di tutto questo è molto lenta e odora di free to play (anche se il gioco non lo è assolutamente) finendo per allungare in maniera inutile l'esperienza di gioco. Molto positiva invece la presenza di numerosi temi che permettono di cambiare l'estetica di gioco, si passa da reiterpretazioni di grafiche retrò fino ad ambientazioni stravaganti come un'ufficio o la luna.

In definitiva si tratta di un gioco consigliato se si cerca qualcosa per ammazzare il tempo e da giocare a piccole sessioni tra titoli più impegnativi.

Commento finale: "Championship Edition è però di tutt'altro livello"

30285444.review: A fantastic spin on the classic that stays true to classic Pac-Man while being supremely addictive. Basically it's an infinite Pac-Man maze where you have to survive as long as possible, and you get bonus points if you manage to eat 256 consecutive dots. To keep things fresh, you basically play to unlock further power-ups which make you more and more powerful. It's a good progression that makes you really want to play one more game to get the next powerup, but doesn't feel like a grind. Each round gives a great sense of progress and I topped out the final power-up after about 10 hours of play, which felt like good value and even now I find myself still playing just to top my old scores. Pac-Man 256 isn't quite as flashy or over-the-top as the also-excellent Championship games, but I feel like there's more room for strategizing with how you can pick what powerups you want, and there's a great sense of split-second decision making: Do I go for the powerup or try to keep the dot chain going? Can I keep this going, or should I escape the ghosts? Stuff like that makes the game fun and exciting and it feels like no two rounds are ever quite the same. Great game!

30234463.review:
Drawing inspiration from kill screen from the classic game, getting to level 256 will result in a glitch that ends the game.  Using that as the inspiration, this game involves trying to get away from that glitch by making it into an endless runner.  By changing the formula, does it result in a better game?

Being made by the same people that made the mobile game [i]Crossy Road[/i], the game has the same look and feel of that game.  The graphics shared the same block look of that game.  One thing that is good about this is that for those that prefer a different look, the game offers multiple styles to customize it to the player's taste.  From the Namco's [i]Pac-Mania[/i] and [i]Rally-X[/i] to Hipster Whale's [i]Crossy Road[/i] and even a few surreal styles like an office, a garden, and inside a computer, the variety makes it that there is something for everybody.  There is even an option to randomize it to make each game feel different every time.

Just like classic [i]Pac-Man[/i], the player has to go through mazes while eating dots, power ups, and bonus items while avoiding the ghosts.  Since it was also made by the same company that made [i]Crossy Road[/i], the game also involves constant forward movement to avoid the glitch—the thing where the title's 256 came from.  Besides the classic power pellets, new power ups like lasers and fire and new ways to attack the ghost or protect the player—all of which are upgradable through coins collected through gameplay.  Additionally, the game keeps tracks of not only your own score, but the scores of your friends as well.  This makes that the player has incentive keep playing to beat their friend's score.  

Even with these updates, there is one big problem with the game.  Unlike the classic games, the game involves constantly moving forward instead of clearing each maze.  This makes it that the player has to move forward constantly instead of going after every dot.  Since each pattern will pass in just a few seconds, the maze will start repeating after only a couple of minutes.  Even with the extra looks mentioned before, it does not change the fact that it is the same few maze patterns looping around.  Despite the new features, it does not take long before the game feels like a big case of déjà vu.

One thing that brings the gameplay above its mobile roots is that up to four players can play at the same time.  Each player selects their look, and they work with (or against) each other to fight the ghosts.  The combined scored will be on the top just like the singleplayer mode.  As for the individual scores, they appear on the side where the friend scores normally appear.  Unlike the single player, it does not necessarily mean game over when an enemy catches you.  Once something catches a player, a spinning Pac-Man item will appear.  Grabbing it will bring the dead player back.  This is one way that the game allows players choose to work with or against each.  If they want help, grabbing it means more ways to attack the ghosts.  However, if treating the game like a versus game, players can leave it alone to boost their own score.  This makes that you will even question what kind of game you are in once you are waiting to see if the other players will bring you back or not.  With this level of unpredictability, the multiplayer is much better overall experience than the single player game.

Whether this game is worth playing depends on how people will play with it.  As a single player game, it will get old fast.  However, by adding multiplayer, the game has enough life to justify continuous play.  Make sure that you plan to play with other players.  Without them, there is not content to warrant a purchase.

30079308.review:
PAC-MAN 256 is another variant of the famous PAC-MAN formula.

The basic Pac-Man gameplay is more or less intact but the game adds infinite random levels and upgradable powerups to the mix. Unfortunately neither of these additions really improves the base game.

The random levels are a decent idea, but they cause some problems too. Most importantly, they do make the gameplay rather unfair too. Even in the original PAC-MAN you sometimes end up in unwinnable situations, but in PAC-MAN 256 this is a far too common occurance as you can only see a small section of the (infinite) level around you.

The loadout system on the other hand feels like a pointless addition and the only justification for its existance seems to be the microtransactions in the original mobile release. The microtransactions are thankfully gone in the Steam version, but that doesn't make the rather grindy unlocks any more exciting or meaningful.

Overall I didn't feel that PAC-MAN 256 adds much to the original game, you are much better off playing the far superior PAC-MAN Championship Edition instead.

The good:
- The core Pac-Man gameplay still holds up well

The bad:
- The upgrade system feels extremely grindy and pointless
- The random levels lead to too many unfair situations

30073897.review:
PAC-MAN 256 is a variant on the venerable game of PAC-MAN. It is an endless arcade game where you, controlling PAC-MAN, navigate your way through a maze, collecting dots along the way. Unlike the traditional PAC-MAN game, however, the maze is endless in the vertical direction. Using procedural generation, you must navigate your way upwards, while being pursued by the glitch – a wave of numbers, garbage characters, and darkness which gradually eats up the maze from below.

The title of this game – and the wave of darkness that pursues you – are references to a glitch in the original PAC-MAN game, where the 256th level created a bunch of garbage on the screen, generating an impassible kill-screen.

The game itself is very reminiscient of PAC-MAN, but is somewhat more sophisticated; there’s about twice as many ghost types, each of which have their own behavioral pattern. If PAC-MAN touches any ghost or the wall of glitches at the bottom of the screen, it is game over.

Orange ghosts try to go to the bottom of the screen, choosing to turn towards the horizontal side of the screen that PAC-MAN is on, but always turning down when able.

Red ghosts pursue PAC-MAN endlessly.

Pink Ghosts will remain dormant until PAC-MAN comes into a straight line with them, at which point the ghost will fly towards PAC-MAN at a speed faster than PAC-MAN’s own.

Grey ghosts will sleep until PAC-MAN approaches, then pursue PAC-MAN via the shortest route.

Teal ghosts will circle endlessly around a certain portion of the map, generally a single wall; this can sometimes lead to unexpected behavior, though, as they can also circle the OUTSIDE of the map, which can make them somewhat unpredictable when first spotted.

Green Ghosts always appear in groups of 3-4, and move a bit slower than PAC-MAN in a horizontal back-and-forth manner.

Purple Ghosts are similar to Green Ghosts, but move back and forth much more slowly, but will track PAC-MAN’s horizontal movement; you must move around them reasonably quickly (or use a power-up) to get past them.

Glitch ghosts constantly change color, and occasionally teleport around the battlefield; they pursue the player somewhat slowly.

All of this combines to make the core gameplay a bit different from normal PAC-MAN, but still familiar in many ways.

There are power-ups that you can pick up over the course of the game to kill ghosts with or to do other things. In addition to the basic power pills which turn ghosts blue, slowing them down and allowing you to eat them by running over them (and scoring ever more points by doing so), there are 21 powerups with various other effects. About half of them are variations on the power pill, but with added powers – one leaves a firey trail behind you, another shoots a laser beam in front of PAC-MAN, a third turns all ghosts in a radius around PAC-MAN into cherries, fruit which also appear naturally and give you extra points and a point multiplier.

The other half of the abilities are stranger. There are a couple of abilities that create roving entities that home in on ghosts and kill them for you, but don’t make PAC-MAN himself invincible. There are some abilities which simply slow down ghosts, which are pretty bad abilities, but one of them also gives you the ability to score a bunch of extra points (generally inferior to just killing ghosts, though). One creates static traps around the map to kill ghosts, and a couple allow PAC-MAN to gather dots, power-ups, and fruits in a wider radius.

You may select up to three of these abilities before you start each game, and the abilities are gradually unlocked by eating dots. The abilities can also be levelled-up by spending in-game currency on them, found via random loot drops after games, as well as by completing various tasks that the game gives you (such as eating five apples, or killing 20 ghosts with the tornado power-ups).

While all of this combines to make the game feel like it has a bit more of a point than a standard PAC-MAN game, in the end the game here is very simple, and it starts to get pretty samey after a while. While adding the unlockable power-ups makes the game a bit more interesting, and the various quests add a slight spin on things, the reality is that the game itself is very samey – there is a multiplayer mode and a single-player mode, but both are just endlessly running down a maze which, in the end, doesn’t have all that many variations on it.

It is a kind of mindless game, and it isn’t bad for what it is. But what it is isn’t exactly aiming for the stars; it is an extremely simplistic game, and most people will likely get bored with it pretty quickly. It is ultimately a bit of a time-waster, and probably better suited for mobile gaming than sitting down and playing it at a PC – it is just not a very sophisticated game. As such, it is difficult for me to recommend it.

En gros, c'est Pac-Man en mode endless runner et avec des power-up. 
Et sinon c'est très moyen, on sent bien le portage d'un jeu smartphone fait à la va-vite. La progression se révèle être très lente : comptez plusieurs heures afin de pouvoir débloquer la totalité des power-up et encore plus d'heures pour tous les améliorer à fond.
Ces mêmes power-up ne sont pas très utiles puisque contrairement à Pac-Man Championship Edition et son système de bombe à activer quand on le souhaite, ici, les power-up se lancent automatiquement une fois récupérée : ils vont donc très souvent être ramassés (et donc utilisés) à des moments où la nécessité d'avoir un power-up est nulle et très souvent absent quand la présence de power-up aurait-été utile, rendant la difficulté très aléatoire. Un système de power-up à la Mario Kart (en pouvant en stocker un à tout moment donc) aurait été bien plus intéressant. 
En somme, passez votre chemin et préférez-lui Pac-Man Championship Edition.

30005110.review:
“吃一颗豆子不能消灭幽灵，那就吃256颗！”
吃豆人256相比与以往你所玩过的吃豆人游戏，可能会有点让你感到意外。因为，你根本吃不完所有豆子！
是的，这款游戏就是无尽版吃豆人。你要不断的尝试往上爬，吃更多的豆子，同时避开那些幽灵，或者，吃掉它们？
在把你面前的豆子变成无限的同时，游戏也加入了一些新“食物”。除了经典的power pellet（还是原来的味道，无敌顺便恐惧幽灵来让你吃掉它们）外，还有各种power-up来让你干掉或吃掉幽灵，有激光、火焰甚至炸弹等！
同时游戏有一个好玩的机制——连吃256个豆子，来清屏一次。这就是pac-man 256的由来了。还请尽量尝试吃到256个吧。
我之所以会喜欢这款游戏的原因，就是简单明了的游戏目标了——尽可能的吃更多豆子。
这游戏用来放松心情真是再好不过的选择了，同时挑战一下刷新最高分数。或者，和同伴一起来玩也是个不错的选择？
但本地多人游戏必须要有手柄才能开始，这一点我很想吐槽的（没手柄成就都解锁不了）。
总之，这款游戏是相当值得入手的，我推荐偶尔玩玩用来放松放松。当然等打折再入也是个不错的选择。

29963828.review:
Oh my god. What the hell happend to PAC-MAN? I realise that this is a Free-2-Play mobile game, which makes it an extra kick in the teeth that I bought this, but this is pretty bad. 

This game was made soley to sink time into. There is no fun anywhere in this. Just die and restart. It follows the model of games like Flappy Bird or Temple Run where you see how far you can get and try and beat your high score. I know that the original Pac-Man was pretty basic but atleast that had levels. That had extra lifes. That was a fun and progressively challenging game that you could master by putting time into it. You could figure out the patterns of each of the Ghosts and use that knowledge to trick them and get past them. This game trys that but just fails miserably. How the hell am I meant to figure out how to dodge a teleporting enemy? Whats the point in trying to get the highscore? You don't progress. There is no end game. 

Also, who decided that Pac-Man needed a load out? Why do I need to customize and upgrade my loadout? The only point in that whole system is to make you play the game more. It gives you a false sense of progression. After you die and complete challenges you get coins. The amount of coins is so little that you have to play the game for hours on end to actually fully upgrade your loadout. This is just a facade to make you think that you are playing a game wqith actual substance. Plus, why have about 20 different weapons when there are only like 3 good ones? And about 5 of the weapons are just better versions of earlier ones. So why upgrade the earlier weapons? Whats the point if its gonna get replaced by a better version of itself?

Honestly, I hated every second of this game. Since my first attempt when I booted it up, to the ten more hours of time put into it (Im one of those guys/assholes that likes Achievements). If your thinking about playing this, get the phone version first and see if you can play it for an hour. If you are not incredibly bored by then, by all means buy the game. But if you get bored after the first couple attempts like I did, then do not buy this. It doesnt get any better. It just gets duller and duller.

3/10

29910348.review:
I got this in a bundle, I guess?  I just know this is not the sort of game I would have intentionally purchased.  And I would have been missing out!  Listen, I'm old, my earliest memories of videogames are of feeding quarters into Pac-Man and Marble Madness at the local pizza joint.  And it's not like video game designers don't spend a lot of time trying to capitalize on nostalgia for the old coin-op days, but they almost never nail it like this.

So, like, you're playing Pac-Man.  The mechanics are sort of like you might remember.  But it's an endless level, constantly growing in one direction while killscreen-style glitches eat it from the other side.  And it's isometric instead of straight-up top-down, there are more ghosts than you might be used to, and a wider variety of powerups, but for the most part everything still has that old Pac-Man feel to it.  Everything's congruent with that old Buckner & Garcia vibe.  It's just better, more suited to casual play, more leaning toward diverse gameplay than the old memorize-the-Ninth-Key-Pattern cabinet game.

This is a fantastic game, and I'm glad to have lucked into it.

Привет из прошлого. Когда мне было 6 лет у меня уже появился комп, такая большая бандура и я уже играл в такие шедевры с графоном как half-life, red alert, quake 3, в тылу врага. Также мне попал диск, с сотней игр, такой себе солянкой, там были игры денди, сега, дум 1\2, куча разновидностей тетрисов и лайнс. Я любил играть в такие игры, меня привлекали такие простые игры, среди которых была и пак-мен. Я никогда не забуду тот триумф который я испытывал когда я всетаки проходил очередной уровень, и безысходность когда меня зажимали цветастые привидения. Прошли года, и вот я смотрю на эту игру на Андроид, на телефоне она не пошла, слишком он уж древний, но через год, неделю назад я увидел продажу бандла, в который входил пак-мен 256, купил только ради него. Нежалею, да и как можно, игра стоила всего лишь долар, + какая то неплохая рпгшка и симулятор пилота.
Игра меня порадовала, это полноценное возрождение легеды, в ней нет ничего лишнего, но чуствуеться эта "телефонность", это меня немного раздражало, не люблю телефонный интерфейс на больших экранах. Графика пристойная, и можно выбирать ее стиль, от класического 2д до офисной локации где нужно убегать от стульев. Добавили бонусы, чтоб можно было отбиваться от особо напористых привидений, и их будет много так как карта самогенерируется, и тебе всегда нужно продвигаться вперед, ведь тебя накроет волной "глюков" состоящий из рандомных символов и спрайтов привидений. Каждому противнику дали свои особенности, что делает игру интересней, и добавляет тактичности в продумывание твоих действий, особо противные розовые которые бегают по прямой как только увидят тебя и с большой скоростью, и красные которые тебя буду приследовать до смерти, твоей или его. Всех опсывать я не буду, так как это еще больше займет времени, но надеюсь суть вы поняли. Мультиплеер, а это уже проблема. Игра не видит геймпад соньки, и соседский halvit, даже эмуляторы не помогли, а играть на ноутбуке на одной клаве хоть и не мене весело, но страшно неудобно, ну так как нас было трое, то играли по очереди, это печально, также печально, как и то что нельзя сыграть с другом через интернет :(.
Игра мне понравилась, она теперь стильная, современная, также хардовая и недалеко отошла по-общему гейплею от оригинала. Рекомендую.
